cards.flavor:
“You try to strike iron when a Newborn might pop out at any minute.”
—Seppa, former blacksmith
cards.name: Abandoned Forge

rulings.text: If Abandoned Forge enters the battlefield simultaneously with another nonbasic land and you don't control any nonbasic lands, it will enter the battlefield untapped.

cards.text:
Abandoned Forge enters the battlefield tapped if you control another nonbasic land.
{T}: Add {R} or {W}.

cards.flavor: A place of privacy, made obsolete when all the world became one.
cards.name: Abandoned Hideout

rulings.text: Abandoned Hideout enters the battlefield simultaneously with another nonbasic land and you don't control any nonbasic lands, it will enter the battlefield untapped.

cards.text:
Abandoned Hideout enters the battlefield tapped if you control another nonbasic land.
{T}: Add {U} or {R}.

cards.flavor: The walls are still rank with the odor of blood, guts, and worse.
cards.name: Abandoned Laboratory

rulings.text: Abandoned Laboratory enters the battlefield simultaneously with another nonbasic land and you don't control any nonbasic lands, it will enter the battlefield untapped.

cards.text:
Abandoned Laboratory enters the battlefield tapped if you control another nonbasic land.
{T}: Add {W} or {B}.

cards.flavor: Each rustling leaf in Grete's parks was like a behemoth's roar to the people's cursed nerves.
cards.name: Abandoned Preserve

rulings.text: Abandoned Preserve enters the battlefield simultaneously with another nonbasic land and you don't control any nonbasic lands, it will enter the battlefield untapped.

cards.text:
Abandoned Preserve enters the battlefield tapped if you control another nonbasic land.
{T}: Add {B} or {G}.

cards.flavor:
“Our lakes are as a mother's breast; it nourishes for a time, and then we outgrow it.”
—Matatanda, Danawan elder
cards.name: Abandoned Shores

rulings.text: Abandoned Shores enters the battlefield simultaneously with another nonbasic land and you don't control any nonbasic lands, it will enter the battlefield untapped.

cards.text:
Abandoned Shores enters the battlefield tapped if you control another nonbasic land.
{T}: Add {G} or {U}.

cards.flavor:
“Selesnya: despicable, but its hands reach far. Use.”
—Rheila's journal
cards.name: Agent of Vitu-Ghazi
cards.text: Whenever Agent of Vitu-Ghazi deals combat damage to a player, investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with “{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.”)

cards.flavor:
“Then what'd you do with the rest?” asked Dajaman.
“. . . I took responsibility.” replied Rheila, his voice very small.
cards.name: Anguished Unmaking
cards.text: Exile target nonland permanent. You lose 3 life.

cards.name: Bestial Mob

rulings.text: If the target's toughness is greater than or equal to Bestial Mob's toughness as its ability tries to resolve, the ability will be countered.

cards.text:
Bestial Mob's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.
Whenever Bestial Mob deals combat damage to a player, destroy target creature with toughness less than Bestial Mob's power.

cards.name: Blood Frenzy
cards.text:
Target creature gets +3/-3 until end of turn.
Kindle 3—{B}{R}, Pay 3 life. ({B}{R}, Pay 3 life, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create three 1/1 colorless Elemental creature tokens. Kindle only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Boneforged Arms

cards.flavor: More than mere distance stands in the way of pilgrims and Langan.
cards.name: Border Guardian

rulings.text: The return is not optional, and you will have to bounce Border Guardian if you control no other creatures.

cards.text:
Vigilance, trample
When Border Guardian enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Breaking News
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample and “Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, investigate.” (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with “{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.”)

cards.flavor: The tribulations of the strata she'd climbed only sharpened her hope.
cards.name: Bundan Firebrand
cards.text:
First strike
Ascend {1}{B} ({1}{B}: Exile this creature, then return it to the battlefield transformed. Ascend only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: In the sunless wastes of Kanlan, that hope died by inches until only resignation remained.
cards.name: Kanlan Jaded
cards.text: Deathtouch

cards.flavor: He saw the truth of the Great Fear, and now he sees nothing else.
cards.name: Burned-Mind Seer
cards.text:
Haste

cards.flavor:
“Those who have known only darkness can neither deserve nor even comprehend the light.”
—Liguno, Lord of Langan

Flying

Target player discards two cards.

cards.flavor: At the bottom of Samang's bowl-like shape lies the watery plateau of Danawan.
cards.name: Danawan Wanderer
cards.text:
When Danawan Wanderer enters the battlefield, you may tap or untap target creature.
Ascend {2}{G} ({2}{G}: Exile this creature, then return it to the battlefield transformed. Ascend only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Many take the pilgrimage up Samang's five strata: placid Danawan, lush Punan, volcanic Bundan, withered Kanlan and, at last, the heaven realm of Langan.
cards.name: Punan Trailblazer
cards.text: Vigilance

cards.flavor: “Morons predict. Masters guide.”
cards.name: Dancing Flames
cards.text:
Dancing Flames deals 2 damage to target creature.
Kindle 2—{3}{R} ({3}{R}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create two 1/1 colorless Elemental creature tokens. Kindle only as a sorcery.)

cards.text:
Destroy all creatures.
Kindle X—{X}, Exile a card with mana value X from your graveyard. ({X}, Exile a card with mana value X and this card from your graveyard: Create X 1/1 colorless Elemental creature tokens. Kindle only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Using people as test subjects is easiest when done to those that none would miss.
cards.name: Deformed Vagrant

rulings.text: If the creature blocking Deformed Vagrant's becomes greater than it's after the block has been assigned, it's still blocking Deformed Vagrant.

cards.text: Creatures with power greater than Deformed Vagrant's power can't block it.

cards.name: Descent of the Stars
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact or land.
Kindle 2—{R}, Sacrifice an artifact or land. ({R}, Sacrifice an artifact or land, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create two 1/1 colorless Elemental creature tokens. Kindle only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor:
“Would even lightning touch me now?”
—Remy, the Last
cards.name: Distant Thunder
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card or pay {2}.
Distant Thunder deals 3 damage to any target.

cards.flavor:
“I've too much work to let myself be caught.”
— Rheila Rachy
cards.name: Doctored Trail

rulings.text: If the Clue is not on the battlefield when Doctored Trail tries to resolve, you will not draw a card. If that Clue is still on the battlefield but has indestructible or it is regenerated, you will draw a card.

cards.text:
{2}, Sacrifice Doctored Trail: Draw a card.
{T}, Sacrifice Doctored Trail: Destroy target Clue. If you do, draw a card.

cards.flavor: Newborn made of fire share both its heat and its transience.
cards.name: Emberling
cards.text: When Emberling dies, it deals 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Embrace Samang

rulings.text: Embrace Samang doesn't count itself when counters are placed on it.
This is not a mana ability.

cards.text:
When Embrace Samang enters the battlefield, put a charge counter on it for each color among permanents you control.
At the beginning of your precombat main phase, remove a charge counter from Embrace Samang. If you do, draw a card, then add one mana of any color.

cards.name: Ephemeral Support

Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has double strike.

cards.flavor: It lives to give.

rulings.text: Fleeting Memory will attempt to exile itself every end step, even if the ability is countered, exiled, or avoided by ending the turn.

cards.text: You may have Fleeting Memory enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except it has “At the beginning of the end step, exile this creature.”

cards.name: Flickercloak

Enchant creature

Kindle 2—{2}{W} ({2}{W}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create two 1/1 colorless Elemental creature tokens. Kindle only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor:
“Wash them all away and let the Pact sort it out.”
—Iskji, Simic hydromancer

Return all creatures with toughness 3 or less to their owners' hands.

cards.flavor:
“Anything can become a Newborn — even stench, sadly enough.”
—Huono, Elama lifereader
cards.name: Foul Drifter

Flying
When Foul Drifter enters the battlefield, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fractal Findings

cards.text:
When Fractal Findings enters the battlefield, investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with “{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.”)
Whenever you sacrifice a Clue, you may draw a card, then discard a card. (You make this choice before drawing a card from the Clue.)

cards.name: Gnuge-District Hoarder
cards.text:
When Gnuge-District Hoarder enters the battlefield, each opponent loses 1 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

cards.flavor: Some afflicted never stopped running, while others were too scared to start.

cards.text:
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
Paranoia {G} (You may cast this spell for its paranoia cost when a permanent you control leaves the battlefield.)

cards.flavor: The Grete District's many parks and nature reserves were abandoned when the Great Fear fell, letting animals roam the district freely.
cards.name: Grete-District Strider
cards.text: Trample

cards.flavor:
“Shield of the shieldless. Blade of the bladeless. All else is meaningless.”
— Rheila Rachy
cards.name: Guardian's Resolve
cards.text: Target permanent gains hexproof and indestructible until end of turn. Scry 1.

cards.flavor:
“There is power in shapes: the far-reaching triangle, the eternal circle... and the piercing helix.”
— Huono, Elama lifereader

cards.text:
Flying, lifelink, haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Helix Entity.

cards.flavor: “Money? I can always just steal money. If you want to know what I know, little lizard man, entertain me.”
cards.name: Highspire Informant
cards.text:
Flying
When Highspire Informant enters the battlefield, scry 1.

cards.flavor: The cries of those begging to be let in were mistaken for the wailing of monsters, and the barricade was only reinforced further.

When Hollow Hooligan enters the battlefield, up to two target creatures can't block this turn.

When Horizon Gazer enters the battlefield, reveal the top two cards of your library. Put a noncreature card revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
Ascend {3}{G} ({3}{G}: Exile this creature, then return it to the battlefield transformed. Ascend only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: “Small minds see only the glory above. Only when you're ready to face all Samang are you truly a pilgrim.”
cards.name: Weathered Pilgrim
cards.text: When Weathered Pilgrim enters the battlefield, return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: The mutant's ichor blood arced across the air, and Rheila froze; he'd seen it before.

cards.text: Insightful Blow deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature. Investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with “{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.”)

cards.flavor: All born on the second-highest stratum are forbidden from heaven, and so they banish or kill those who seek it — but were they rejected for wickedness, or did wickedness stem from rejection?

cards.text: Menace

cards.name: Kin of the Rainforest

When Kin of the Rainforest enters the battlefield, you may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.
Ascend {1}{R} ({1}{R}: Exile this creature, then return it to the battlefield transformed. Ascend only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Punan's fertility teaches pilgrims to coexist with nature's bounty. Bundan's savagery teaches them to abuse it.
cards.name: Desperate Ravager
cards.text: Sacrifice a land: Desperate Ravager gets +2/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: No answer will bring him peace.

cards.flavor: It's hard to stand your ground when the ground itself stands against you.

Trample

Ascend—{B}, Discard two cards. ({B}, Discard two cards: Exile this creature, then return it to the battlefield transformed. Ascend only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: In Kanlan's forgotten places, she seeks answers that may one day redeem it.
cards.name: Wanderer of Oblivion
cards.text:
Whenever Wanderer of Oblivion enters the battlefield or attacks, exile target card from a graveyard.
You may play cards exiled with Wanderer of Oblivion.

cards.flavor: Skeletons in the collective closet of Ravnica's medicinal world, the Disfigured were used as guinea pigs, then forsaken.
cards.name: Lifecraft Aberration
cards.text:
Pay 2 life: Lifecraft Aberration gains indestructible until end of turn.
Pay 3 life: Lifecraft Aberration gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Hermit crabs are often used by Elama's lifereaders in predicting and tracking the elemental Newborn.
cards.name: Lifeshell Crab
cards.text: Kindle 4—{4}{U}{U} ({4}{U}{U}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create four 1/1 colorless Elemental creature tokens. Kindle only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Liguno, Who Transcends All

rulings.text: If Liguno and one or more other permanents you control would be put into a graveyard simultaneously, they are all exiled instead.

All cards exiled by Liguno will return to the battlefield simultaneously. Starting with the active player and proceeding in turn order, each player decides the order of any abilities they control that trigger this way and puts them on the stack.

cards.text:
Flying
If Liguno, Who Transcends All or another permanent you control would be put into a graveyard from the battlefield, exile it instead. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Living Antimagic
cards.text:
Flash
Flying
When Living Antimagic enters the battlefield, counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}.
Spells that target Living Antimagic cost {2} more to cast.

cards.name: Looking Glass
cards.text:
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Looking Glass: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
Kindle 1—{1} ({1}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a 1/1 colorless Elemental creature token. Kindle only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Even after the Skull replaced life with mirage, the loresprouts and the stories upon their leaves endured.

cards.flavor: Before, Remy had only seen the bad in his home; now, he could only grieve the good.
cards.name: Paralyzing Ennui
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -4/-0.
Mirage {U} (You may cast this spell as though it had flash for its mirage cost. If you do, sacrifice it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.)

cards.flavor: “I spared little thought to the victims my experiments left behind. I assumed them dead. Oh, how wrong I was.”
cards.name: Past Unresolved
cards.text: You draw two cards, lose 2 life, and mill two cards.

cards.flavor: Even in Langan, the highest realm, there are heights to aspire to.
cards.name: Patient Ascetic
cards.text:
Defender
Ascend {1}{W}{W} ({1}{W}{W}: Exile this creature, then return it to the battlefield transformed. Ascend only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: All who seek the glory of angelic existence are rejected at first. Only those who better themselves in spite of rejection are taken into the flock.
cards.name: Graceful Angel
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: Her gifts are immaterial and her embrace without weight, but her support can still uplift a tired heart.
cards.name: Phantasmal Samaritan
cards.text: When Phantasmal Samaritan enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.

cards.flavor: The first beings to inhabit Evanescier still linger, and they don't like what they see.
cards.name: Precursors' Disdain
cards.text:
Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each of those creatures.
Mirage {1}{U} (You may cast this spell as though it had flash for its mirage cost. If you do, sacrifice it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.)

cards.flavor:
“I had seen them from below, faintly, like mortals gaze at stars. I thought that sufficient to prepare me. But only when I came face to face with them did I realize how truly small I am, and how truly unfathomable this world is.”
— Dwaga the Coward
cards.name: Punan Mammoth

cards.flavor: The drakes saw no victims or sinners — only playmates.
cards.name: Rakdos Drakeswarm
cards.text:
Flying
{B}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Once, she dreamed fondly of the world above. The Great Fear turned each dream into a nightmare.
cards.name: Reclusive Mermaid
cards.text:
Hexproof
Paranoia {1}{U} (You may cast this spell for its paranoia cost when a permanent you control leaves the battlefield.)

cards.flavor: As Evanescier broke apart around him, Remy knew that the Skull had heard his wish.
cards.name: Reform Reality
cards.text: Each player exiles all permanents they control, draws that many cards, then puts up to that many permanent cards from their hand onto the battlefield. Exile Reform Reality.

cards.flavor: “I just wanted to be alone. And now, I am.”
cards.name: Remy, Last of Evanescier

rulings.text: Remy has protection from any object that has the subtype Illusion, including any abilities with an Illusion object as their source. In practice, Remy has protection from everything but Remy and emblems, but it also won't have protection from anything that loses the Illusion subtype.

Remy's ability that adds Kindred - Illusion uses timestamps. If a permanent loses all creature types before Remy enters the battlefield, it will be an Illusion, if it loses all creature types after Remy enters the battlefield, it will not.

cards.text:
Protection from Illusions
All cards that aren't on the battlefield, spells, and other permanents are Illusion kindreds in addition to their other types.

cards.flavor:
“We know what you all do, in the shadows behind. The pain ends now.”
—Writing on the wall
cards.name: Revenge of the Disfigured
cards.text: Destroy target creature. Investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with “{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.”)

cards.name: Rheila Rachy

rulings.text: An emblem outside the command zone ceases to exist.

cards.text:
[+1]: Up to one other target permanent gains hexproof and indestructible until your next turn.
[-3]: Destroy target tapped permanent.
[-7]: You get an emblem with “If you would lose the game, instead exile this emblem, shuffle all cards you own that aren't on the battlefield into your library, then draw seven cards. Your life total becomes 40.”

cards.flavor: “We have suffered long enough, my children. Rise with me. Our justice comes.”
cards.name: Saljan, Lord of the Disfigured
cards.text:
Saljan, Lord of the Disfigured and other Mutants you control get +1/+1 and have indestructible.
Whenever Saljan attacks or blocks, create a 1/2 black Mutant creature token.

cards.flavor: At Rheila's behest, those Disfigured who would cease their revenge were taken in by Ravnica's healers to atone for their mistreatment.
cards.name: Sanctuary for the Forsaken
cards.text: If a source would deal combat damage to you or a creature you control, prevent 1 of that damage.

cards.id: Savants of the Ley//Tyrants of Bundan_KLC
cards.name: Savants of the Ley
cards.text:
Untap all creatures and lands you control during each other player's untap step.
Ascend {4}{R}{R}{R} ({4}{R}{R}{R}: Exile this creature, then return it to the battlefield transformed. Ascend only as a sorcery.)

cards.id: Savants of the Ley//Tyrants of Bundan_KLC
cards.name: Tyrants of Bundan
cards.text:
Trample, haste
When Tyrants of Bundan enters the battlefield, tap all lands target player controls. They don't untap during their controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Secrets Unearthed
cards.text:
Search your library for a card, reveal it, then shuffle and put that card on top.
Kindle 3—{3}{B} ({3}{B}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create three 1/1 colorless Elemental creature tokens. Kindle only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Skull of the World

rulings.text: You can discard a hand of no cards, but the ability will do nothing. Once you have activated Skull of the World, it is too late to draw or discard cards to change whether or not you discarded a card to activate it.

cards.text: {T}, Discard your hand: If two or more cards were discarded this way, search your library for a card and put that card into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.flavor: Even the rays of Elama's sun are blessed by its unique mana, spawning new life wherever they fall.
cards.name: Solar Wisp
cards.text: When Solar Wisp enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.flavor:
“You either take the moment, or the moment takes you.”
— Dajaman Rachy
cards.name: Split-Second Decision
cards.text:
Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
“Whatever's doing the killing out there, we can be sure of one thing: it's got a type.”
—Severin, Azorius hussar
cards.name: Stalked Healer
cards.text:
Lifelink
When Stalked Healer enters the battlefield, investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with “{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.”)

cards.flavor: The Disfigured struck, and for an instant, Rheila thought to let them kill him—but in another, he knew he couldn't.
cards.name: Stay Determined

rulings.text: If one or more replacement effects are being applied to you, for example Stay Determined and glory counters, you choose the order that they apply.
This card uses a replacement effect. This means the player who chooses which library will be affected in the case of multiple libraries can be messy to determine.
Life loss caused by combat damage has no controller. The player affected by the replacement effect will choose which libraries will be affected.
Life loss caused by spells and abilities either by direct life loss or by damage has the same controller as the spell or ability. That player will choose which libraries will be affected.

cards.text: Until end of turn, if a source you don't control would deal damage to you or cause you to lose life, mill that many cards instead.

cards.flavor:
“Sometimes, a moment of silence is the best guide you can have.”
—Severin, Azorius hussar
cards.name: Still the Pandemonium
cards.text: Counter target noncreature spell. Investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with “{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.”)

cards.flavor:
“Even if you never reach Langan, you'll still have risen above who you were before.”
—Matatanda, Danawan elder
cards.name: Strive for the Heavens
cards.text: Transformed creatures you control get +2/+2.

cards.flavor:
“These unnatural Newborn will rise until we are ousted from our own land.”
—Soini, Elama fearmonger
cards.name: Swell of Birth
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a charge counter on Swell of Birth, then create a 1/1 colorless Elemental creature token for each charge counter on it.

cards.flavor:
“Why do the walls of Bundan cry? Why do you care? Spend your time more wisely, and plan for the next one.”
— Mainina, Samang pilgrim
cards.name: Tears of Samang
cards.text: Tears of Samang deals 3 damage to each creature and each player. If an opponent would be dealt damage this way, you may have Tears of Samang deal 3 damage to a planeswalker they control instead.

cards.name: The Midwife

rulings.text: You can choose 0. The creature the target you contro becomes will likely die the next time state-based actions are checked.

cards.text: {X}{G}: Put X +1/+1 counters on target noncreature, nonplaneswalker permanent you control. It becomes an Elemental creature with base power and toughness 0/0 in addition to its other types. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.name: Thomar, Fearbringer
cards.text:
Other creatures have haste and attack each combat if able.
Nonland cards in your hand have paranoia {4}. (The owner of a card with paranoia {4} may cast it from their hand for {4} when a permanent they control leaves the battlefield.)

cards.name: Thomar's Sowing
cards.text: Target player mills five cards. Draw a card for each card type among cards milled this way. (The card types are artifact, creature, enchantment, land, instant, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal.)

cards.flavor: Like clockwork, the illusionary villagers rioted every day for the same impropriety.
cards.name: Torches Raised
cards.text:
Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
Mirage {2}{R} (You may cast this spell as though it had flash for its mirage cost. If you do, sacrifice it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.)

cards.flavor: On Elama, even life itself has a life of its own.
cards.name: Vitality Unbridled
cards.text:
You gain twice X life.
Kindle X—{X}{G}{G} ({X}{G}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create X 1/1 colorless Elemental creature tokens. Kindle only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: When the Great Fear fell upon Weltall, it looked to its soldiers for safety; but they too had succumbed to paranoia.
cards.name: Wehre-District Patrollers

rulings.text: Wehre-District Patrollers will get this bonus whether or not it is also attacking or blocking.

cards.text: Whenever you attack or block with one or more other creatures, Wehre-District Patrollers gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
“Ten witness accounts. Eleven angles. In Ravnica, all viable.”
—Rheila's journal
cards.name: Wheat from Chaff
cards.text: Draw two cards, then discard two cards. Investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with “{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.”)
